H0.text: Metals are the type of elements that make up the majority of elements, including iron and copper.

H1.text: Oils are the type of the majority of elements, including iron and copper.

H2.text: Acids are the type of elements that comprise the majority of elements, including iron and copper.

H3.text: Minerals are the type of the majority of elements, including iron and copper.

A4.text: Other significant metallic alloys are those of aluminium, titanium, copper, and magnesium.

A5.text: The term 'ferrous' is derived from the Latin word meaning 'containing iron'.
